titles.title: Regulatory Efficiency Act
To provide that certain regulations shall not take effect unless published in final form not later than 18 months after the date of publication of general notice of proposed rulemaking.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

bill.summary: 5/18/1995--Introduced. Regulatory Efficiency Act - Prohibits a covered regulation from taking effect unless it is published in final form within 18 months after the date of publication of a general notice of proposed rulemaking for the regulation. Defines "covered regulation" as the whole or a part of an agency statement of general or particular applicability and future effect designed to implement, interpret, or prescribe law or policy, other than such a statement to carry out an agency's routine administrative function.
